learn-quizzes.wallets-4-a-explanation: A wallet is a visual interface used to interact with an Ethereum account.
learn-quizzes.wallets-4-b-explanation: A wallet is a visual interface used to interact with an Ethereum account.
learn-quizzes.security-1-prompt: Why should you use unique passwords for all of your accounts?
learn-quizzes.security-1-a-label: In case one of the platforms has a data breach
learn-quizzes.security-1-a-explanation: This answer is correct, but there are also other correct answers.
learn-quizzes.security-1-b-label: In case someone looking over your shoulder works out your password
learn-quizzes.security-1-b-explanation: This answer is correct, but there are also other correct answers.
learn-quizzes.security-1-c-label: In case malware, such as a key-logger, steals your password
learn-quizzes.security-1-c-explanation: This answer is correct, but there are also other correct answers.
learn-quizzes.security-1-d-explanation: All answers are correct. Using unique passwords is the best way to prevent anyone else from accessing your account.
learn-quizzes.security-2-prompt: Following The Merge, ETH must be upgraded to ETH2.
learn-quizzes.security-2-a-explanation: You do not need to upgrade your ETH to ETH2. There is no ETH2 and this is a common narrative used by scammers.
learn-quizzes.security-2-b-explanation: You do not need to upgrade your ETH to ETH2. There is no ETH2 and this is a common narrative used by scammers.
learn-quizzes.security-3-a-label: A good way to get more ETH
learn-quizzes.security-3-a-explanation: ETH giveaways are scams designed to steal your ETH and other tokens. They are never a good way to get more ETH.
learn-quizzes.security-3-c-label: Commonly performed by prominent members of the community
learn-quizzes.security-3-c-explanation: Prominent community members do not do ETH giveaways. Scammers pretend well-know individuals, such as Elon Musk, are doing giveaways to give them the scam a sense of legitimacy.
learn-quizzes.security-3-d-label: Are very likely to be a scam
learn-quizzes.security-3-d-explanation: ETH giveaways are always scams. Reporting and ignoring scammers is best.
learn-quizzes.security-4-a-explanation: Ethereum transactions cannot be reversed. Anyone who tells you otherwise might be trying to scam you.
learn-quizzes.security-4-b-explanation: Ethereum transactions cannot be reversed. Anyone who tells you otherwise might be trying to scam you.
learn-quizzes.nfts-1-prompt: NFTs are most comprehensively defined as:
learn-quizzes.nfts-1-a-explanation: NFTs represent a unique digital asset.
learn-quizzes.nfts-1-b-explanation: NFTs represent a unique digital asset, this is commonly digital artwork, but it isn’t limited to art.
learn-quizzes.nfts-1-c-explanation: NFTs represent a unique digital asset, this could be a ticketing system, but it isn't limited to tickets.
learn-quizzes.nfts-1-d-explanation: Although a legal contract could be represented as an NFT, NFTs are not exclusive to legally binding contracts.
learn-quizzes.nfts-2-prompt: Two NFTs representing the same artwork are the same thing.
learn-quizzes.nfts-2-a-explanation: NFTs are non-fungible. This means even if they represent the piece of digital art, they are still uniquely identifiable. In the traditional artworld, this might be similar to originals and prints.
learn-quizzes.nfts-2-b-explanation: NFTs are non-fungible. This means even if they represent the piece of digital art, they are still uniquely identifiable. In the traditional artworld, this might be similar to originals and prints.
learn-quizzes.nfts-3-a-explanation: This is a security risk and generally a bad idea!
learn-quizzes.nfts-3-b-label: Ownership of a unique digital item
learn-quizzes.nfts-3-b-explanation: NFTs commonly represent ownership of a unique digital item.
learn-quizzes.nfts-3-c-explanation: NFTs cannot represent your ETH balance arbitrarily.
learn-quizzes.nfts-3-d-explanation: NFTs commonly represent ownership of a unique digital item, not ETH balances or wallet passwords.
learn-quizzes.nfts-4-prompt: NFTs have helped create a new:
learn-quizzes.nfts-4-a-explanation: NFTs helped create a new economy for creators, not curators.
learn-quizzes.nfts-4-b-explanation: NFTs helped create a new economy for creators, not carbon.
learn-quizzes.nfts-4-c-explanation: NFTs helped create the creator economy.
learn-quizzes.nfts-4-d-explanation: NFTs helped create a new economy for creators, not doges 🐶.
learn-quizzes.nfts-5-prompt: NFTs on Ethereum are harmful to the environment
learn-quizzes.nfts-5-a-explanation: Since The Merge (transition to proof-of-stake), any transaction has been a negligible impact on the environment.
learn-quizzes.nfts-5-b-explanation: Since The Merge (transition to proof-of-stake), any transaction has been a negligible impact on the environment.
learn-quizzes.rollups-1-a-explanation: The primary purpose of rollups and other layer 2 solutions is for scaling Ethereum.
learn-quizzes.rollups-1-b-explanation: The primary purpose of rollups and other layer 2 solutions is for scaling Ethereum.
learn-quizzes.rollups-1-c-explanation: The primary purpose of rollups and other layer 2 solutions is for scaling Ethereum.
learn-quizzes.rollups-1-d-explanation: The primary purpose of rollups and other layer 2 solutions is for scaling Ethereum.
learn-quizzes.rollups-2-prompt: To scale, most alternative layer 1 networks have primarily sacrificed on:
learn-quizzes.rollups-2-a-explanation: Most alternative Layer 1 networks sacrifice on security and something else in order to scale.
learn-quizzes.rollups-2-b-explanation: Most alternative Layer 1 networks sacrifice on decentralization and something else in order to scale.
learn-quizzes.rollups-2-c-explanation: Token price does not have any impact on scaling ability.
learn-quizzes.rollups-2-d-explanation: Most alternative layer 1 networks sacrifice on both security and decentralization in order to scale.
learn-quizzes.rollups-3-prompt: Which of the following are not considered to be layer 2?
learn-quizzes.rollups-3-a-explanation: Validiums are not considered to be layer 2 solutions as they do not derive security or data availability from Ethereum. This is not the only correct answer.
learn-quizzes.rollups-3-b-explanation: Sidechains are not considered to be layer 2 solutions as they do not derive security or data availability from Ethereum. This is not the only correct answer.
learn-quizzes.rollups-3-c-explanation: Alternative layer 1 blockchains are not considered to be layer 2 solutions. This is not the only correct answer.
learn-quizzes.rollups-3-d-explanation: Validiums, Sidechains, and alternative layer 1 blockchains are not considered to be layer 2 solutions as they do not derive security or data availability from Ethereum.
learn-quizzes.rollups-4-prompt: Why does Ethereum not have an ‘official’ layer 2?
learn-quizzes.rollups-4-a-label: Core developers are too busy working on Ethereum
learn-quizzes.rollups-4-a-explanation: There are no plans for an ‘official’ layer 2 on Ethereum as we’ll benefit from a wide-variety of approaches to designing layer 2 solutions.
learn-quizzes.rollups-4-b-label: As an L1, Ethereum will eventually reach mass scaling on its own
learn-quizzes.rollups-4-b-explanation: There are no plans for an ‘official’ layer 2 on Ethereum as we’ll benefit from a wide-variety of approaches to designing layer 2 solutions.
learn-quizzes.rollups-4-c-label: Core developers are still debating between optimistic and zk-rollups
learn-quizzes.rollups-4-c-explanation: There are no plans for an ‘official’ layer 2 on Ethereum as we’ll benefit from a wide-variety of approaches to designing layer 2 solutions.
learn-quizzes.rollups-4-d-label: Ethereum will benefit from a wide-variety of approaches to designing an L2
learn-quizzes.rollups-4-d-explanation: There are no plans for an ‘official’ layer 2 on Ethereum as we’ll benefit from a wide-variety of approaches to designing layer 2 solutions.
learn-quizzes.merge-1-prompt: The Merge moved Ethereum onto which consensus mechanism?
learn-quizzes.merge-1-a-explanation: Proof-of-work was the consensus mechanism used before The Merge.
learn-quizzes.merge-1-b-explanation: Correct! The Merge moved Ethereum onto proof-of-stake.
learn-quizzes.merge-1-c-explanation: Ethereum does not, and has never used proof-of-authority on Ethereum Mainnet.
learn-quizzes.merge-1-d-explanation: It would not be possible for Ethereum to have all of these consensus mechanisms at once.
learn-quizzes.merge-2-prompt: The Merge reduced Ethereum’s energy consumption by:
learn-quizzes.merge-2-a-explanation: Ethereum’s energy consumption was reduced by 99.95% after The Merge enabled the transition from proof-of-work to proof-of-stake.
learn-quizzes.merge-2-b-explanation: Ethereum’s energy consumption was reduced by 99.95% after The Merge enabled the transition from proof-of-work to proof-of-stake.
learn-quizzes.merge-2-c-explanation: Ethereum’s energy consumption was reduced by 99.95% after The Merge enabled the transition from proof-of-work to proof-of-stake.
learn-quizzes.merge-2-d-explanation: Ethereum’s energy consumption was reduced by 99.95% after The Merge enabled the transition from proof-of-work to proof-of-stake.
learn-quizzes.merge-3-a-explanation: The Merge happened on September 15th 2022 at 06:42:42 AM (UTC).
learn-quizzes.merge-3-b-explanation: The Merge happened later than this. December 1st 2020 was when the Beacon Chain was launched.
learn-quizzes.merge-3-c-explanation: The Merge happened later than this. November 27, 2013 was when the Ethereum whitepaper was released.
learn-quizzes.merge-3-d-explanation: The Merge happened later than this. October 31st is the day the Bitcoin Whitepaper was released.
learn-quizzes.merge-4-prompt: The Merge meant users had to exchange their ETH for ETH2:
learn-quizzes.merge-4-a-explanation: ETH did not change at any point before, during, or after The Merge. The idea of ‘upgrading’ ETH to ETH2 was a common tactic by malicious actors to scam users.
learn-quizzes.merge-4-b-explanation: ETH did not change at any point before, during, or after The Merge. The idea of ‘upgrading’ ETH to ETH2 was a common tactic by malicious actors to scam users.
learn-quizzes.merge-5-prompt: Ethereum’s consensus layer was formerly known as:
learn-quizzes.merge-5-a-explanation: Proof-of-work was the consensus mechanism used before The Merge.
learn-quizzes.merge-5-b-explanation: Before being renamed the consensus layer, it was originally called ‘Eth2’.
learn-quizzes.merge-5-c-explanation: Eth1 was the original name given to the execution layer, not the consensus layer.
learn-quizzes.merge-5-d-explanation: Staking is depositing ETH into a smart contract to help secure the chain.
learn-quizzes.daos-1-a-label: DAOs are collectively owned via governance tokens
learn-quizzes.daos-1-a-explanation: DAOs are collectively owned, but that’s not the only correct statement.
learn-quizzes.daos-1-b-label: They are governed by their members
learn-quizzes.daos-1-b-explanation: DAOs are governed by their members, but that’s not the only correct statement.
learn-quizzes.daos-1-c-label: They are working towards a shared mission
learn-quizzes.daos-1-c-explanation: DAOs are working towards a shared mission, but that’s not the only correct statement.
learn-quizzes.daos-1-d-explanation: Correct, a DAO is a collectively-owned, blockchain-governed organization working towards a shared mission.
learn-quizzes.daos-2-prompt: What are practical examples of how to use a DAO?
learn-quizzes.daos-2-a-label: Decentralized protocols, members vote on the matters of the protocol or how to develop the product
learn-quizzes.daos-2-a-explanation: Protocol DAOs are one example, but DAOs are not limited to that.
learn-quizzes.daos-2-b-label: Collective ownership, e.g., for NFTs or physical assets
learn-quizzes.daos-2-b-explanation: Collector DAOs are one example, but DAOs are not limited to that.
learn-quizzes.daos-2-c-label: Ventures and grants, pool capital and vote on projects to fund
learn-quizzes.daos-2-c-explanation: Venture or grants DAOs are one example, but DAOs are not limited to that.
learn-quizzes.daos-2-d-explanation: A DAO can have a multitude of 'missions'.
learn-quizzes.daos-3-a-explanation: DAOs are usually flat, and fully democratized.
learn-quizzes.daos-3-b-label: Transparent and fully public about their activities
learn-quizzes.daos-3-b-explanation: Thanks to onchain voting, decisions are transparent on the blockchain. Discussions and other elements of the decision-making process are open to all members.
learn-quizzes.daos-3-c-explanation: Changes require voting by the members. Services offered are handled automatically in a decentralized manner.
learn-quizzes.daos-3-d-label: Restricted regarding who can suggest changes
learn-quizzes.daos-3-d-explanation: Usually, every DAO member can suggest changes.
learn-quizzes.daos-4-prompt: What is essential about smart contracts for DAOs?
learn-quizzes.daos-4-a-label: The smart contract code can be modified
learn-quizzes.daos-4-a-explanation: Once the contract is live on Ethereum, no one can change the rules except by a vote. This allows the DAO to run by the rules it was programmed with.
learn-quizzes.daos-4-b-label: It has an individual owner who retains authority to make changes and send from the treasury.
learn-quizzes.daos-4-b-explanation: The treasury is defined by the smart contract. To spend money, the group's approval is needed.
learn-quizzes.daos-4-c-label: Trust in the underlying blockchain's distributed consensus
learn-quizzes.daos-4-c-explanation: It’s important for a DAO that the underlying blockchain cannot be manipulated. Ethereum’s own consensus is distributed and established enough for organizations to trust the network.
learn-quizzes.daos-4-d-explanation: The backbone of a DAO is its smart contract, which defines the rules of the organization and holds the group's treasury.
learn-quizzes.daos-5-prompt: What is not a mechanism to govern a DAO?
learn-quizzes.daos-5-a-explanation: Token-based governance is very widely used. It’s usually fully permissionless and is typically used to govern broad decentralized protocols and/or tokens themselves.
learn-quizzes.daos-5-b-explanation: Share-based DAOs are more permissioned but still quite open. Any prospective member can submit a proposal to join the DAO, usually offering a tribute of some value in the form of tokens or work.
learn-quizzes.daos-5-c-explanation: Unlike token or share-based membership, reputation-based DAOs don't transfer ownership to contributors. DAO members must earn reputation through participation.
learn-quizzes.daos-5-d-label: Executive board and offchain treasury management
learn-quizzes.daos-5-d-explanation: This approach uses highly centralized and opaque mechanisms of governing. On the contrary, DAOs use verifiable voting mechanisms and onchain treasury management to ensure transparency and accountability.
learn-quizzes.staking-solo-1-a-label: Penalty for being offline, rewards resume when back online
learn-quizzes.staking-solo-1-a-explanation: Being offline does NOT result in slashing. Small penalties are incurred for being offline, and rewards resume when the validator returns online and resumes attestations.
learn-quizzes.staking-solo-1-b-label: Penalty for being offline, validator is immediately prohibited from attesting ever again
learn-quizzes.staking-solo-1-b-explanation: Being offline does NOT result in slashing. While slashing will result in the validator being prohibited from ever attesting again and is ultimately forcefully ejected, being offline will NOT result in ejection from the network.
learn-quizzes.staking-solo-1-c-label: Penalty for breaking specific consensus rules, rewards resume after slashing
learn-quizzes.staking-solo-1-c-explanation: Slashing is a serious penalty for breaking specific consensus rules that present a threat to the network. As such, once a validator is slashed they are immediately prohibited from attesting any further, and are ultimately forcefully ejected from the network and remaining ETH is withdrawn to the owner.
learn-quizzes.staking-solo-1-d-label: Penalty for breaking specific consensus rules, validator is immediately prohibited from attesting ever again
learn-quizzes.staking-solo-1-d-explanation: Slashing is a serious penalty for breaking specific consensus rules that present a threat to the network. As such, once a validator is slashed they are immediately prohibited from attesting any further, and are ultimately forcefully ejected from the network and remaining ETH is withdrawn to the owner.
learn-quizzes.staking-solo-2-prompt: What happens if a validator goes offline?
learn-quizzes.staking-solo-2-a-explanation: Penalties are incurred when a validator is unavailable to attest to the state of the chain for any given epoch. The size of these penalties is approximately equal to 75% of what the reward for a proper attestation would have been. Rewards resume when validator goes back online, and NO slashing occurs.
learn-quizzes.staking-solo-2-b-label: Inactivity penalties are incurred only while unavailable
learn-quizzes.staking-solo-2-b-explanation: While unavailable, a validator will incur small inactivity penalties, approximately equal to 75% of what the reward would have been for a proper attestation. In rare/extreme cases where the network is not finalizing (i.e. over 1/3 of the network is also offline), these penalties are significantly greater. Rewards resume when validator goes back online, and no slashing occurs.
learn-quizzes.staking-solo-2-c-label: Immediate slashing and removal from the network
learn-quizzes.staking-solo-2-c-explanation: This is a common misconception, but going offline does NOT result in slashing! Slashing is a specific type of penalty for more serious offense, with larger penalties and also results in removal from the validator set.
learn-quizzes.staking-solo-2-d-label: One week delay before slashing and ejection
learn-quizzes.staking-solo-2-d-explanation: Being offline does NOT result in slashing, even after extended period of time. A validator could theoretically be offline for years without being slashed, though inactivity penalties would mount if the validator does not exit.
learn-quizzes.staking-solo-3-prompt: What is the max effective balance of a validator?
learn-quizzes.staking-solo-3-a-explanation: Validators who drop to an effective balance of 16 ETH are automatically exited from the Beacon Chain.
learn-quizzes.staking-solo-3-b-explanation: 32 ETH is both the minimum ETH required to activate a new validator, and also the maximum 'effective balance' (vote weight) for that validator. Rewards above 32 can be accrued, but this balance does not contribute to the weight of that validators vote on the network and rewards are not increased.
learn-quizzes.staking-solo-3-c-explanation: The rules of consensus apply to every validator account equally and are not dependent upon the individual operating the node. The max effective balance of all validators is 32 ETH.
learn-quizzes.staking-solo-3-d-explanation: Each validator account is limited to an effective balance of 32 ETH, limiting the overall power of any single validator on the network. This also limits how much ETH can be staked or un-staked in a given time period, as validator activations and exits are processed through a rate-limited queue.
learn-quizzes.staking-solo-4-prompt: Which is NOT a reward received as a validator?
learn-quizzes.staking-solo-4-a-explanation: Validators receive rewards in the form of new ETH issuance for proposing a valid block when randomly selected by the protocol. These rewards are separate from the fees and MEV that are also earned when proposing blocks.
learn-quizzes.staking-solo-4-b-explanation: Fee tips (unburnt portion of fees) and MEV earnings are distributed to the block proposer (staker/validator) via the fee recipient address provided by that validator. These rewards are separate from the block reward also earned when proposing blocks.
learn-quizzes.staking-solo-4-c-explanation: Validators receive rewards in the form of new ETH issuance for correctly and promptly attesting to the head of the chain, the current justified epoch head, and the current finalized epoch head.
learn-quizzes.staking-solo-4-d-explanation: Trading fees generated by trading platforms and exchanges are not received by Ethereum validators.
learn-quizzes.staking-solo-5-prompt: What uptime is required for a validator to be profitable?
learn-quizzes.staking-solo-5-a-explanation: Although an ideal target, achieving 100% uptime is not the minimum requirement for a validator to remain profitable.
learn-quizzes.staking-solo-5-b-explanation: Although an excellent target, achieving 99% uptime is not the minimum requirement for a validator to remain profitable.
learn-quizzes.staking-solo-5-c-explanation: Validators are penalized approximately 75% of what they would have been rewarded for correctly and promptly attesting to the state of the chain. This means for a given time period, being offline 50% of that time will still be net profitable, albeit less profitable than a more reliably available validator.
learn-quizzes.staking-solo-5-d-explanation: A validator with only 25% uptime will be incurring penalties for the other 75% of the time. Given the similar size of rewards and penalties, being offline for 3x the amount of time online will result in a net loss of ETH for that time period.
learn-quizzes.staking-solo-6-prompt: Which of the following is NOT a slashable offense?
learn-quizzes.staking-solo-6-a-explanation: Simply being offline does not result in slashing. It will result in small inactivity penalties while offline, but will resume attesting when back online.
learn-quizzes.staking-solo-6-b-label: Proposing and signing two different blocks for the same slot
learn-quizzes.staking-solo-6-b-explanation: This threatens the integrity of the network and will result in slashing and ejection from the network.
learn-quizzes.staking-solo-6-c-label: Attesting to a block that 'surrounds' another one (effectively changing history)
learn-quizzes.staking-solo-6-d-label: 'Double voting' by attesting to two candidates for the same block
learn-quizzes.staking-solo-7-prompt: Which is NOT a way to protect/prevent your validator from being slashed?
learn-quizzes.staking-solo-7-a-label: Avoid overly redundant setups, and only store your keys with one validator client at a time
learn-quizzes.staking-solo-7-a-explanation: The majority of slashing to date are from operators storing their signing keys on more than one machine, as a redundant backup. This is highly risky, as any malfunction can result in double voting and slashing.
learn-quizzes.staking-solo-7-b-label: Run client software as-is without altering the code yourself
learn-quizzes.staking-solo-7-b-explanation: Client software is written and tested to protect against performing slashable actions. To execute a slashable action, this would typically require altering the client code yourself in a malicious manner.
learn-quizzes.staking-solo-7-c-label: Run a client that is being used by the majority of other validators
learn-quizzes.staking-solo-7-c-explanation: Using the same client as a majority of the rest of the network puts you at risk for being slashed in the event of a software bug in that client. Running a minority client protects against this.
learn-quizzes.staking-solo-7-d-label: Disable validator for 2-4 epochs before migrating keys to a new machine
learn-quizzes.staking-solo-7-d-explanation: This allows time to allow the chain to finalize while your node is offline, to minimize any risk of accidental double voting and slashing during key migration.
learn-quizzes.staking-solo-8-prompt: Which is NOT required to receive reward payments / partial withdrawals?
learn-quizzes.staking-solo-8-a-label: Providing an execution withdrawal address one time
learn-quizzes.staking-solo-8-a-explanation: This is required once for the withdrawal process to know where to send any consensus layer funds to
learn-quizzes.staking-solo-8-b-label: Having an effective balance of 32 ETH
learn-quizzes.staking-solo-8-b-explanation: Your effective balance must be maxed out at 32 ETH before any partial withdrawals will trigger.
learn-quizzes.staking-solo-8-c-label: Having a total balance over 32 ETH
learn-quizzes.staking-solo-8-c-explanation: Your total balance must have rewards above 32 ETH for any partial withdrawals to trigger.
learn-quizzes.staking-solo-8-d-label: Submitting requested withdrawal amount with gas payment
learn-quizzes.staking-solo-8-d-explanation: Once the other criteria are met, reward payments are automatic. Recipients do not need to submit a transaction or pay gas. Amount withdrawn is equal to validator's balance in excess of 32. Custom amounts cannot be requested.
learn-quizzes.scaling-1-prompt: Which of the following is Ethereum using to scale?
learn-quizzes.scaling-1-a-explanation: These help Ethereum scale by bundling transactions, executing them, and then posting the results to Ethereum for validation and securing. Examples or rollups include Arbitrum or Optimism. This is not the only way Ethereum is scaling.
learn-quizzes.scaling-1-b-explanation: This provides a temporary and inexpensive storage option for saving rollup data to Mainnet, which currently is responsible for approximately 90% of the cost a user encounters on a rollup. This is not the only way Ethereum is scaling.
learn-quizzes.scaling-1-c-explanation: This removes the need for every validator and node on the network from being required to store 100% of the data for all rollups, reducing hardware requirements for node operators. This is not the only way Ethereum is scaling.
learn-quizzes.scaling-1-d-explanation: Layer 2 rollups bundle transactions, Proto-Danksharding creates cheap temporary storage for this data, and Danksharding shares the storage burden across all validators—all helping Ethereum scale.
learn-quizzes.scaling-2-prompt: After bundling transactions and executing them, what do layer 2 rollups do next?
learn-quizzes.scaling-2-a-label: Store the data on a private server
learn-quizzes.scaling-2-a-explanation: Results are posted to Mainnet for transparency and public availability, and are not reliant on private servers.
learn-quizzes.scaling-2-b-label: Sends the proof to the user for storage
learn-quizzes.scaling-2-b-explanation: Users are not expected to hold onto the results of their transaction. This information is posted to Mainnet.
learn-quizzes.scaling-2-c-explanation: Layer 2 rollups post the results of their transaction execution to Mainnet, securing it in Ethereum's history
learn-quizzes.scaling-2-d-label: Delete the result to reduce costs
learn-quizzes.scaling-2-d-explanation: Layer 2 rollups post the results of their transaction execution to Mainnet. The cost savings achieved with this approach is by bundling and compressing transaction data, and ultimately storing it in cheap storage that expires once made available to those who need it.
learn-quizzes.scaling-3-prompt: How does Proto-Danksharding reduce rollup transaction costs on rollups?
learn-quizzes.scaling-3-a-explanation: Proto-Danksharding does not directly increase the gas limit, but does make the storage of rollup data less expensive by making temporary storage available
learn-quizzes.scaling-3-b-label: Splitting up which validators are required to store the data
learn-quizzes.scaling-3-b-explanation: Although full Danksharding is expected to reduce the need for all validators to store all of the data, this is preceded by Proto-Danksharding which forms a less-expensive, temporary storage option for the data produced by rollups.
learn-quizzes.scaling-3-c-label: Significantly increasing hardware requirements for node operators
learn-quizzes.scaling-3-c-explanation: This is generally not considered an acceptable option for scaling Ethereum. Great efforts are taken to minimize hardware requirements for operating a node to keep it as accessible as possible.
learn-quizzes.scaling-3-d-label: Storing its data in cheaper, temporary 'blob' storage
learn-quizzes.scaling-3-d-explanation: Proto-Danksharding introduces a temporary data storage option for rollups to allow them to more cheaply post its results to Mainnet
learn-quizzes.scaling-4-prompt: What is a critical next step for rollups to scale Ethereum?
learn-quizzes.scaling-4-a-label: Incentivize entities with powerful computers to handle all of the sequencing
learn-quizzes.scaling-4-a-explanation: One of the problems with current rollups is the centralized nature of those running the sequencers (those who decide the inclusion and ordering of transactions within a rollup). The goal is to allow anyone to participate, and not rely on a single group or entity in any way.
learn-quizzes.scaling-4-b-label: Distribute responsibility for running sequencers and provers across more people
learn-quizzes.scaling-4-b-explanation: Control over a rollup typically starts off centralized, which helps get things started, but leaves the network prone to censorship. Decentralizing the process of including transactions so anyone can participate is essential to prevent the possibility of network compromise.
learn-quizzes.scaling-4-c-label: Make all rollups conform to the same method of security
learn-quizzes.scaling-4-c-explanation: Ethereum benefits from having a wide range of approaches to security within its rollup ecosystem as a form of resiliency.
learn-quizzes.scaling-4-d-label: Data oracles to confirm storage of transaction data on private servers
learn-quizzes.scaling-4-d-explanation: Rollup data is stored on Ethereum, and does not rely on private servers or databases.
learn-quizzes.run-a-node-1-prompt: What is required to run a node?
learn-quizzes.run-a-node-1-a-label: Running client software with modest hardware while staying online.
learn-quizzes.run-a-node-1-a-explanation: Operating a node consists of running software that communicates using the language of the Ethereum protocol with other computers doing the same. This software downloads a copy of the Ethereum blockchain, verifies the validity of every block, then keeps it up-to-date with new blocks and transactions, while helping others download and update their own copies.
learn-quizzes.run-a-node-1-b-explanation: This is a requirement for staking—the process of becoming an active participant in network consensus. This is not required to simply run a sovereign copy of the blockchain, which requires NO ETH.
learn-quizzes.run-a-node-1-c-label: Operate powerful ASIC mining machines to reach network consensus
learn-quizzes.run-a-node-1-c-explanation: Although Ethereum previously used mining with powerful computers to reach consensus, this process has been replaced entirely by staking. Neither mining in the past, nor staking currently, are required to simply operate a sovereign copy of the blockchain.
learn-quizzes.run-a-node-1-d-label: Work full time in blockchain infrastructure
learn-quizzes.run-a-node-1-d-explanation: Software tooling has continued to improve over time making running a node from home as a novice much more approachable. Working full-time in blockchain infrastructure is by no means a requirement to get involved.
learn-quizzes.run-a-node-2-prompt: How much ETH do you need to stake to run a node?
learn-quizzes.run-a-node-2-a-explanation: Operating an Ethereum node does not require any ETH. In contrast to operating a staking validator as part of a node setup, anyone is free to run client software and sync their own sovereign copy of the blockchain—no ETH required.
learn-quizzes.run-a-node-2-d-explanation: Operating an Ethereum node does not require any ETH. In contrast to the 32 ETH required to activate a staking validator that participates directly in network consensus, anyone is free to run client software and sync their own sovereign copy of the blockchain—no ETH required.
learn-quizzes.run-a-node-3-prompt: What benefits do you get from running your own node?
learn-quizzes.run-a-node-3-a-explanation: This is a benefit to users, but is not the only one. By running node software that communicates directly with other peers on the network, your transactions get mixed in with every other transaction your node is propagating. As such, it's nearly impossible to differentiate and censor a valid transaction that your node has shared.
learn-quizzes.run-a-node-3-b-explanation: This is a benefit to users, but not the only one. By having your own copy of the Ethereum blockchain, you no longer depend on any single external party to interact with the network. You never have to ask permission to look up your balance, or to execute a transaction, and all transactions are verified using software you're running yourself. When network upgrades occur, you're in charge of whether to support the upgrade or not.
learn-quizzes.run-a-node-3-c-explanation: This is a benefit to users, but is not the only one. Without your own node, simply looking up your account balances typically requires sending a list of your accounts from your wallet, attached to your IP address, to a third-party provider who then is being trusted to provide you with the correct information.
learn-quizzes.run-a-node-3-d-explanation: Running a node gives you full control and sovereignty over the data you're relying on, allowing you to privately view and verify the contents of the chain, and effectively guarantee that any valid transactions are not censored.
learn-quizzes.run-a-node-4-prompt: What hard drive storage is required for an Ethereum node?
learn-quizzes.run-a-node-4-a-explanation: Currently, no client software is capable of storing the chain using only 512 GB
learn-quizzes.run-a-node-4-b-explanation: Generally speaking, rotating hard disks do not support the read/write speeds needed to keep up with processing requirements for an Ethereum node, and an SSD drive is recommended
learn-quizzes.run-a-node-4-c-explanation: At time of writing, a 2 TB SSD drive should satisfy the storage and read/write speed requirements for a full Ethereum node.
learn-quizzes.run-a-node-4-d-explanation: At time of writing, a 2 TB SSD drive should satisfy the storage and read/write speed requirements for a full Ethereum node. An 8 TB SSD would allow for more future-proofing, and the ability to also sync layer 2 chains, but is not currently a requirement for Mainnet.
learn-quizzes.run-a-node-5-prompt: What happens if your node goes offline?
learn-quizzes.run-a-node-5-a-label: Your node drops out of sync with the current state of the network
learn-quizzes.run-a-node-5-a-explanation: When your node is not available online, it is unable to receive new transactions and blocks from peers, and as such falls out-of-sync with the current state of the chain. Connecting back online will allow your node software to get synced back up to be fully functional again.
learn-quizzes.run-a-node-5-b-label: The ETH in your cold storage is slashed
learn-quizzes.run-a-node-5-b-explanation: ETH held in your cold storage has nothing to do with your node being online or not. If your node is offline, you won't be able to use it to look up the latest balance of your accounts, but being offline does not put your secured funds at risk. If you're also running validator software with your node as a staker, small penalties will be incurred to this validator balance while unavailable to the network.
learn-quizzes.run-a-node-5-c-label: The energy used looking for proof-of-work is wasted
learn-quizzes.run-a-node-5-c-explanation: Ethereum no longer uses proof-of-work, and this was never a requirement of all node operators. Being offline simply means your node is no longer in sync with the latest changes on the network, and can re-sync by returning online.
learn-quizzes.run-a-node-5-d-label: Chain data is removed, and re-syncing from scratch is required
learn-quizzes.run-a-node-5-d-explanation: Simply going offline does not typically delete any saved chain data. Connecting back to the internet will allow the software to resume where it left off to sync up with the latest transactions.
learn-quizzes.run-a-node-6-prompt: Running a node earns network rewards
learn-quizzes.run-a-node-6-a-explanation: Simply running client software does not earn you rewards. To earn rewards, you must also be staking.
learn-quizzes.stablecoins-1-a-label: Cryptocurrencies with low price volatility, their value is steady and similar to traditional currencies
learn-quizzes.stablecoins-1-a-explanation: Correct! Stablecoins are designed to address the volatility issue common in many cryptocurrencies.
learn-quizzes.stablecoins-1-b-explanation: This is incorrect. While some stablecoins might be backed by precious metals, they can also be backed by fiat currency or other cryptocurrencies.
learn-quizzes.stablecoins-1-c-label: A new type of credit card
learn-quizzes.stablecoins-1-c-explanation: This is incorrect. Stablecoins are a type of cryptocurrency, not a credit card.
learn-quizzes.stablecoins-1-d-explanation: This is incorrect. Stablecoins are not designed to replace ether (ETH). They are another token on the Ethereum network designed to maintain steady value over time.
learn-quizzes.stablecoins-2-prompt: Which of the following is a stablecoin?
learn-quizzes.stablecoins-2-a-explanation: This is incorrect. While stablecoins can represent the US dollar, a US dollar is not a cryptocurrency.
learn-quizzes.stablecoins-2-b-explanation: This is incorrect. AAVE is a governance token for the Aave protocol, which provides marketplaces for stablecoins, but AAVE itself is not a stablecoin.
learn-quizzes.stablecoins-2-c-explanation: Correct! Dai is probably the most famous decentralized stablecoin, and its value is roughly 1 US Dollar.
learn-quizzes.stablecoins-2-d-explanation: This is incorrect. Ether is the native currency of the Ethereum network, but it is not intended to be stable.
learn-quizzes.stablecoins-3-prompt: What can stablecoins be used for?
learn-quizzes.stablecoins-3-a-label: To protect its users from volatile changes in price
learn-quizzes.stablecoins-3-a-explanation: Not quite. This answer is partially correct, but it's only one of the many things stablecoins can be used for.
learn-quizzes.stablecoins-3-b-label: To buy things on the internet anywhere in the world
learn-quizzes.stablecoins-3-b-explanation: Not quite. This answer is partially correct, but it's only one of the many things stablecoins can be used for.
learn-quizzes.stablecoins-3-c-label: To earn money by lending to others
learn-quizzes.stablecoins-3-c-explanation: Not quite. This answer is partially correct, but it's only one of the many things stablecoins can be used for.
learn-quizzes.stablecoins-3-d-explanation: Correct! Stablecoins can be used to hold cryptocurrency with less volatility, transact globally on the internet, and earn interest when you lend them out.
learn-quizzes.stablecoins-4-a-label: It is a token that is tied to an asset in the real world
learn-quizzes.stablecoins-4-a-explanation: This is incorrect. While many stablecoins are pegged to real-world assets, this characteristic is not exclusive to stablecoins (e.g., ETH-collateralized tokens).
learn-quizzes.stablecoins-4-b-label: It is a cryptocurrency token specifically designed to keep its value steady
learn-quizzes.stablecoins-4-b-explanation: Correct! Stablecoins are designed to keep their value relatively stable, typically pegged to assets like currencies (e.g., 1 USDC = 1 US dollar), but not all stablecoins follow this model (e.g., RAI).
learn-quizzes.stablecoins-4-c-label: It is capable of being sent over the internet
learn-quizzes.stablecoins-4-c-explanation: This is incorrect. While this is a capability, it is not unique to stablecoins.
learn-quizzes.stablecoins-4-d-label: It can be used on the Ethereum network.
learn-quizzes.stablecoins-4-d-explanation: This is incorrect. Many other cryptocurrency tokens can be used on the Ethereum network.
learn-quizzes.stablecoins-5-prompt: What is NOT a way to get stablecoins?
learn-quizzes.stablecoins-5-a-explanation: Incorrect, this is a way to get stablecoins. One of the most common ways people acquire stablecoins is by swapping their existing cryptocurrencies for stablecoins.
learn-quizzes.stablecoins-5-b-explanation: Incorrect, this is a way to get stablecoins. You can borrow some stablecoins by using your existing cryptocurrencies, such as ether, as collateral. You will need to pay the borrowed stablecoins back to reclaim your locked collateral.
learn-quizzes.stablecoins-5-c-explanation: Incorrect, this is a way to get stablecoins. Many exchanges and wallets let you buy stablecoins directly. Geographical restrictions may apply for centralized exchanges.
learn-quizzes.stablecoins-5-d-explanation: Correct! Unlike bitcoin, you are unable to mine stablecoins.
learn-quizzes.defi-1-a-explanation: Correct! DeFi refers to Decentralized Finance, a financial system built on Ethereum that operates without intermediaries like banks or financial institutions.
learn-quizzes.defi-1-b-explanation: This is incorrect. Digital Finance refers to financial services that are provided through digital platforms, but it doesn’t specifically imply decentralization.
learn-quizzes.defi-1-c-explanation: This is incorrect. While 'distributed' could imply decentralization, the term used in the industry is 'Decentralized Finance,' not Distributed Finance.
learn-quizzes.defi-1-d-explanation: This is incorrect. Development Finance typically refers to financial support provided for projects aimed at economic development, often in developing countries, and is unrelated to blockchain or DeFi.
learn-quizzes.defi-2-prompt: What CAN'T you do with DeFi?
learn-quizzes.defi-2-a-explanation: This is incorrect. With DeFi, you can send value to anybody anywhere in the world, without any limits.
learn-quizzes.defi-2-b-label: Ask customer support to revert your mistakes.
learn-quizzes.defi-2-b-explanation: Correct! In DeFi, transactions are final and controlled by code rather than a company. If a mistake happens, like sending funds to the wrong address, there’s no customer support to help fix it. You need to be extra careful.
learn-quizzes.defi-2-c-explanation: This is incorrect. With DeFi, you can borrow money instantly, avoiding the days-long approval process of traditional banks.
learn-quizzes.defi-2-d-explanation: This is incorrect. DeFi allows you to trade tokens 24/7. Markets are always open, and you can trade your ETH against USDT or any other currency anytime.
learn-quizzes.defi-3-prompt: Which DeFi platform is known for allowing users to swap tokens directly with one another?
learn-quizzes.defi-3-a-explanation: Correct! Uniswap is a decentralized exchange that allows users to trade (swap) tokens directly with each other using automated market-making mechanisms.
learn-quizzes.defi-3-b-explanation: This is incorrect. Aave is a DeFi protocol focused on lending and borrowing, not token swaps.
learn-quizzes.defi-3-c-explanation: This is incorrect. PoolTogether runs no-loss lotteries which offer a new innovative way to save money.
learn-quizzes.defi-3-d-explanation: This is incorrect. MakerDAO is a decentralized platform that allows users to issue and manage the DAI stablecoin, but it doesn’t focus on token swaps.
learn-quizzes.defi-4-prompt: When you use a DeFi app and make a transaction, where is the transaction information kept?
learn-quizzes.defi-4-a-explanation: This is incorrect. Data is not stored in ether (ETH). ETH is the native asset of the Ethereum blockchain.
learn-quizzes.defi-4-b-explanation: This is incorrect. A wallet is an application that manages your Ethereum account by connecting to the Ethereum blockchain. It doesn't store any data about your transaction history.
learn-quizzes.defi-4-c-explanation: This is incorrect. DeFi apps don’t store your transaction history directly. Instead, your transaction details are recorded on the Ethereum blockchain.
learn-quizzes.defi-4-d-explanation: Correct! Ethereum as a blockchain stores all the data made by its users and apps. This allows validators to maintain the same state across the P2P network.
learn-quizzes.defi-5-prompt: What makes Decentralized Finance (DeFi) possible on Ethereum?
learn-quizzes.defi-5-a-explanation: Correct! Smart contracts are like digital 'if-then' statements written into Ethereum. They replace traditional contracts and middlemen, automatically executing transactions if certain conditions are met.
learn-quizzes.defi-5-b-explanation: This is incorrect. Ethereum doesn't need middlemen for transactions to run. Everything runs on the chain through smart contracts.
learn-quizzes.defi-5-c-explanation: This is incorrect. Bitcoin is a simple network for storing value, not for running advanced programs. DeFi requires a more flexible system, like Ethereum, that can run complex programs to handle loans and trades automatically.
learn-quizzes.defi-5-d-explanation: This is incorrect. DeFi apps don’t need traditional financial institutions. They use blockchain programs called smart contracts to handle transactions automatically.

page-bug-bounty.page-upgrades-bug-bounty-annotations: It might be helpful to check out the following annotations:
page-bug-bounty.page-upgrades-bug-bounty-client-bugs-des: Clients run the Ethereum Network, and they need to follow the logic set out in the specification and be secure against potential attacks. The bugs we want to find are related to the implementation of the protocol.

Currently execution layer clients (Besu, Erigon, Geth, Nethermind and Reth) and consensus layer clients (Lighthouse, Lodestar, Nimbus, Teku and Prysm) are included in the Bug Bounty Program. More clients may be added as they complete audits and become production ready.
page-bug-bounty.page-upgrades-bug-bounty-clients-type-2: Unexpected crashes, RCE or denial of service (DOS) vulnerabilities
page-bug-bounty.page-upgrades-bug-bounty-clients-type-3: Any issues causing irreparable consensus splits from the rest of the network
page-bug-bounty.page-upgrades-bug-bounty-misc-bugs-desc: The Solidity and Vyper compilers are in scope of the bug bounty program. Please include all details necessary to reproduce the vulnerability such as: Input program that triggers the bug, Compiler version affected, Target EVM version, Framework/IDE if applicable, EVM execution environment/client if applicable and Operating system, Please include steps to reproduce the bug you have found in as much detail as possible.
page-bug-bounty.page-upgrades-bug-bounty-misc-bugs-desc-: Solidity and Vyper does not hold security guarantees regarding compilation of untrusted input – and we do not issue rewards for crashes of the compiler on maliciously generated data.
page-bug-bounty.page-upgrades-bug-bounty-deposit-bugs-de: The specifications and source code of the Beacon Chain Deposit Contract is part of the bug bounty program.
page-bug-bounty.page-upgrades-bug-bounty-dependency-bugs: Certain dependencies are crucial for the Ethereum Network to function, and some of these have been added to the bug bounty program. Currently, the list of dependencies included in the bug bounty program are C-KZG-4844 and Go-KZG-4844.
page-bug-bounty.page-upgrades-bug-bounty-hunting-desc: The bug bounty program is an experimental and discretionary rewards program for our active Ethereum community to encourage and reward those who are helping to improve the platform. It is not a competition. You should know that we can cancel the program at any time, and awards are at the sole discretion of Ethereum Foundation bug bounty panel. In addition, we are not able to issue awards to individuals who are on sanctions lists or who are in countries on sanctions lists (e.g. North Korea, Iran, etc). Local laws require us to ask for proof of your identity. You are responsible for all taxes. All awards are subject to applicable law. Finally, your testing must not violate any law or compromise any data that is not yours and must take place on local running testnets.
page-bug-bounty.page-upgrades-bug-bounty-hunting-leaderb: Find consensus layer bugs to get added to this leaderboard
page-bug-bounty.page-upgrades-bug-bounty-hunting-executi: Find execution layer bugs to get added to this leaderboard
page-bug-bounty.page-upgrades-bug-bounty-hunting-li-1: Issues without a POC or that have already been submitted by another user or are already known to spec and client maintainers are not eligible for bounty rewards.
page-bug-bounty.page-upgrades-bug-bounty-hunting-li-2: Public disclosure of a vulnerability or reporting it to other parties without prior agreement makes it ineligible for a bounty.
page-bug-bounty.page-upgrades-bug-bounty-hunting-li-3: Employees and contractors of the Ethereum Foundation or client teams in scope of the bounty program may participate in the program only in the accrual of points and will not receive monetary rewards.
page-bug-bounty.page-upgrades-bug-bounty-hunting-li-4: Ethereum bounty program considers a number of variables in determining rewards. Determinations of eligibility, score and all terms related to an award are at the sole and final discretion of the Ethereum Foundation bug bounty panel.
page-bug-bounty.page-upgrades-bug-bounty-ledger-desc: The Ethereum Specifications detail the design rationale for the Execution Layer and Consensus Layer.
page-bug-bounty.page-upgrades-bug-bounty-meta-descriptio: An overview of the Ethereum bug bounty program: how to get involved and reward information.
page-bug-bounty.page-upgrades-bug-bounty-not-included-de: Only the targets listed under in-scope are part of the Bug Bounty Program. This means that for example our infrastructure; such as webpages, dns, email etc, are not part of the bounty-scope. ERC20 contract bugs are typically not included in the bounty scope. However, we can help reach out to affected parties, such as authors or exchanges in such cases. ENS is maintained by the ENS foundation, and is not part of the bounty scope. Vulnerabilities requiring the user to have publicly exposed an API, such as JSON-RPC or the Beacon API, is out of scope of the bug bounty program.
page-bug-bounty.page-upgrades-bug-bounty-points: The EF will also provide rewards based on:
page-bug-bounty.page-upgrades-bug-bounty-points-payout-d: The Ethereum Foundation will pay out the value of USD in ETH or DAI.
page-bug-bounty.page-upgrades-bug-bounty-points-rights-d: The Ethereum Foundation reserves the right to change this without prior notice.
page-bug-bounty.page-upgrades-bug-bounty-quality-desc: : Higher rewards are paid for clear, well-written submissions.
page-bug-bounty.page-upgrades-bug-bounty-quality-fix: Quality of fix, if included: Higher rewards are paid for submissions with clear description of how to fix the issue.
page-bug-bounty.page-upgrades-bug-bounty-quality-repro-d: : A Proof of Concept (POC) must be included to be eligible for rewards. Please include test code, scripts and detailed instructions. The easier it is for us to reproduce and verify the vulnerability, the higher the reward.
page-bug-bounty.page-upgrades-bug-bounty-submit-desc: For each valid bug you find you’ll earn rewards. The quantity of rewards awarded will vary depending on Severity. The severity is calculated according to the OWASP risk rating model based on Impact on the Ethereum Network and Likelihood.
page-bug-bounty.page-upgrades-bug-bounty-subtitle: Earn up to 250,000 USD and a place on the leaderboard by finding protocol, client and language compiler bugs affecting the Ethereum network.
page-bug-bounty.page-upgrades-bug-bounty-type-3: Inconsistencies in assumptions, like situations where honest validators can be slashed
page-bug-bounty.page-upgrades-bug-bounty-validity-desc: Our bug bounty program spans end-to-end: from soundness of protocols (such as the blockchain consensus model, the wire and p2p protocols, proof of stake, etc.) and protocol/implementation compliance to network security and consensus integrity. Classical client security as well as security of cryptographic primitives are also part of the program. When in doubt, send an email to bounty@ethereum.org and ask us. You may also submit a disclosure/vulnerability directly to bounty@ethereum.org, in which case we ask that you encrypt the message using our PGP Key
page-bug-bounty.page-upgrades-bug-bounty-card-text: Attacker can sometimes put a node in a state that causes it to drop one out of every one hundred attestations made by a validator
page-bug-bounty.page-upgrades-bug-bounty-card-text-1: Attacker can successfully conduct eclipse attacks on nodes with peer-ids with 4 leading zero bytes
page-bug-bounty.page-upgrades-bug-bounty-card-text-2: Attacker can successfully partition large parts of the network, and it is trivial for an attacker to trigger the vulnerability
page-bug-bounty.page-upgrades-bug-bounty-card-text-3: Attacker can successfully conduct remote code execution in a majority client, and it is trivial for an attacker to trigger the vulnerability
page-bug-bounty.bug-bounty-faq-q1-title: What should a good vulnerability submission look like?
page-bug-bounty.bug-bounty-faq-q1-contentPreview: See a real example of a quality vulnerability submission.
page-bug-bounty.bug-bounty-faq-q1-content-2: Attack scenario: An attacker can send blocks that may require a high amount of computation (the maximum gasLimit) but has no proof-of-work. If the attacker sends blocks continuously, the attacker may force the victim node to 100% CPU utilization.
page-bug-bounty.bug-bounty-faq-q1-content-3: Impact: An attacker can abuse CPU utilization on remote nodes, possibly causing full DoS.
page-bug-bounty.bug-bounty-faq-q1-content-5: Reproduction: Send a block to a Go node that contains many txs but no valid PoW.
page-bug-bounty.bug-bounty-faq-q1-content-6: Details: Blocks are validated in the method Process(Block, dontReact). This method performs expensive CPU-intensive tasks, such as executing transactions (sm.ApplyDiff) and afterward it verifies the proof-of-work (sm.ValidateBlock()). This allows an attacker to send blocks that may require a high amount of computation (the maximum gasLimit) but has no proof-of-work. If the attacker sends blocks continuously, the attacker may force the victim node to 100% CPU utilization.
page-bug-bounty.bug-bounty-faq-q1-content-7: Fix: Invert the order of the checks.
page-bug-bounty.bug-bounty-faq-q2-title: Is the bug bounty program is time limited?
page-bug-bounty.bug-bounty-faq-q2-content-1: No end date is currently set. See the Ethereum Foundation blog for the latest news.
page-bug-bounty.bug-bounty-faq-q3-contentPreview: Rewards are paid out in ETH or DAI.
page-bug-bounty.bug-bounty-faq-q3-content-1: Rewards are paid out in ETH or DAI after the submission has been validated, usually a few days later. Local laws require us to ask for proof of your identity. In addition, we will need your ETH address.
page-bug-bounty.bug-bounty-faq-q4-title: Can I donate my reward to charity?
page-bug-bounty.bug-bounty-faq-q4-content-1: We can donate your reward to an established charitable organization of your choice.
page-bug-bounty.bug-bounty-faq-q5-title: I reported an issue / vulnerability but have not received a response!
page-bug-bounty.bug-bounty-faq-q5-contentPreview: Please allow a few days for someone to respond to your submission.
page-bug-bounty.bug-bounty-faq-q5-content-1: We aim to respond to submissions as fast as possible. Feel free to email us at bounty@ethereum.org if you have not received a response within a day or two.
page-bug-bounty.bug-bounty-faq-q6-title: I want to be anonymous / I do not want my name on the leader board.
page-bug-bounty.bug-bounty-faq-q6-contentPreview: You can do this, but it might make you ineligble for rewards.
page-bug-bounty.bug-bounty-faq-q6-content-1: Submitting anonymously or with a pseudonym is OK, but will make you ineligible for ETH/DAI rewards. To be eligible for ETH/DAI rewards, we require your real name and a proof of your identity. Donating your bounty to a charity doesn’t require your identity.
page-bug-bounty.bug-bounty-faq-q6-content-2: Please let us know if you do not want your name/nick displayed on the leader board.
page-bug-bounty.bug-bounty-faq-q7-title: What are the points in the leaderboard?
page-bug-bounty.bug-bounty-faq-q7-contentPreview: Every found vulnerability / issue is assigned a score
page-bug-bounty.bug-bounty-faq-q7-content-1: Every found vulnerability / issue is assigned a score. Bounty hunters are ranked on our leaderboard by total points.
page-bug-bounty.bug-bounty-faq-q8-title: Do you have a PGP key?
page-bug-bounty.bug-bounty-faq-q8-content-1: Please use AE96 ED96 9E47 9B00 84F3 E17F E88D 3334 FA5F 6A0A

page-community.page-community-card-1-description: Find your tribe and participate in community with other Ethereum enthusiasts.
page-community.page-community-card-2-description: Find and participate in an Ethereum conference, hackathon, or meetup.
page-community.page-community-card-3-description: Check out how to get involved for a list of ways that you can contribute based on your skills and professional background.
page-community.page-community-card-4-description: Funding grants are available to help you get a project off the ground.
page-community.page-community-contribute-description: For many people, ethereum.org is their first step into the ecosystem. It is kept up-to-date and accurate by thousands of open-source contributors. Want to help? Read our guide on contributing, or take up an issue on our GitHub.
page-community.page-community-daos-callout-description: These groups leverage Ethereum technology to facilitate organization and collaboration. For instance, for controlling membership, voting on proposals, or managing pooled assets.
page-community.page-community-explore-dapps-description: Dapps are applications built on Ethereum. Dapps are disrupting current business models and inventing new ones.
page-community.page-community-get-eth-description: ETH is the native currency of Ethereum. You'll need some ETH in your wallet to use Ethereum applications.
page-community.page-community-get-involved-description: There are many ways to get involved in the fast-growing Ethereum community; you can join one of the popular online communities, attend an event, join a meetup group, contribute to a project, or participate in one of the many online forums about Ethereum.
page-community.page-community-hero-header: Welcome to the Ethereum community hub
page-community.page-community-hero-subtitle: The Ethereum community is home to hundreds of thousands of developers, technologists, designers, users, HODLers and enthusiasts.
page-community.page-community-meetuplist-no-meetups: We don't have any meetups matching this search. Know of one?
page-community.page-community-open-source: Creator? Builder? Get paid for your work.
page-community.page-community-open-source-description: Are you building on Ethereum, or do you want to? Companies are hiring for thousands of technical and non-technical roles. Got an idea of your own? Try finding a grant to get your project off the ground.
page-community.page-community-please-add-to-page: Please add it to this page!
page-community.page-community-support-description: Need support? There is no official Ethereum support, but hundreds of helpful communities are available to help you prosper on Ethereum.
page-community.page-community-upcoming-events-no-events: We're not aware of any upcoming events. Know of one?
page-community.page-community-why-get-involved-card-1-d: There is a tribe for everyone. Find and connect with like minded individuals to discuss, ponder, and celebrate Ethereum together.
page-community.page-community-why-get-involved-card-2-d: Everyone has bills to pay. Ethereum allows you to find meaningful work, and get paid well to do it.
page-community.page-community-why-get-involved-card-3-d: Getting involved with Ethereum allows you to be an active stakeholder in a technology that is having a positive impact on millions of people.
page-community.page-index-internet-image-alt: Illustration of a futuristic computer set up, powered by Ethereum crystals.
page-community.page-index-get-started-image-alt: Illustration of a person working on a computer.
page-community.page-index-get-started-wallet-image-alt: Illustration of a robot with a vault for a body, representing an Ethereum wallet.
page-community.page-index-get-started-eth-image-alt: Illustration of a group of people marvelling at an ether (ETH) glyph in awe.
page-community.page-index-get-started-dapps-image-alt: Illustration of a doge using a computer.
page-community.page-index-get-started-devs-image-alt: An illustration of a hand creating an ETH logo made of lego bricks.

page-contributing-translation-program-ac.page-contributing-translation-program-ac: The Translation Program is a collaborative effort and thousands of contributors have gotten involved by volunteering their time to help us make the website accessible in as many languages as possible.
This page is dedicated to acknowledging our translators and their efforts, highlighting our most outstanding contributors, and supporting them on their professional journeys.
All translators active in our project in Crowdin are featured on our contributors page.
The most active translators in a given period will also earn their place on the Translation Leaderboard.

Professional or upcoming translators, as well as translations students and linguists looking to add a new field of expertise, can request a Translator certificate, to certify their contributions to the website.
We want to acknowledge our translators and support them on their career paths. With this in mind, we have designed the ethereum.org translator certificate.

The certificate is intended for professional and upcoming translators who want to use it as a reference, prove their expertise in translating technical content or simply show their dedication to Ethereum.

If you have contributed to the Translation Program and at least 5,000 of your translated words have been approved, you can request your translator certificate by writing to us at translations@ethereum.org. Your message should include the link to your Crowdin account and your full name (or alias, if you prefer), which we will add to the certificate.
Acknowledgement of all the great work our translators do
Check out our full list of translators who dedicate their time and skills to help make Ethereum content available to everyone.
Community is at the heart of the ethereum.org Translation Program. Explore our full community of translators below.
Help us translate ethereum.org and earn a place on the Translator Leaderboard!

We want to feature outstanding translators based on recent activity as well as highlight our most impactful all-time contributors. Our leaderboard tracks data on the most active translators using a monthly, quarterly and all-time view, and are updated at the start of each month. Translators are placed on the leaderboards based on their number of ''winning'' words (number of translated words that are approved during the review).
Contributors to the Translation Program are eligible for different OATs (onchain achievement tokens) – non-fungible tokens that prove their participation in the ethereum.org Translation Program.
We have a number of different OATs available for translators, based on their activity.
If you have contributed to the translation effort in Crowdin, you have an OAT waiting for you!
Paste a link to your Crowdin account in the #🥇 | proof-of-contribution channel.
Wait for a member of our team to assign you the roles needed to claim your OATs.
You should only use self-custody wallets to claim OATs. Do not use exchange accounts or other accounts you do not hold the private keys to, as these will not allow you to access and manage your OATs.

page-contributing-translation-program-co.page-contributing-translation-program-co: We'd like to thank all of our contributors!
Community is at the heart of the ethereum.org Translation Program.
With thousands of community members contributing translations to our project, it is difficult to acknowledge everyone.

All translators are listed alphabetically based on their chosen name in Crowdin. If you are a translator and would like to use your real name, nickname, ENS domain, etc., you can change your Full Name in Crowdin.
A list of our translation contributors.

page-dapps.page-dapps-add-button: Ba da shawarar amfani da dapp

page-dapps.page-dapps-editors-choice-dark-forest: Yi wasa da wasu don cin nasara akan duniyoyi da kuma gwada fasahar ma'auni / keɓantanwar Ethereum. Wataƙila ɗaya daga ciki sun saba da Ethereum.
page-dapps.page-dapps-editors-choice-foundation: Zuba jari na al'ada. Saya, kasuwanci, da siyar da keɓaɓɓen zane-zanen dijital da salo daga wasu ƙwararrun masu fasaha, mawaƙa, da samfura.
page-dapps.page-dapps-editors-choice-pooltogether: Sayi tikitin caca da babu asara. Kowane mako, ana aika sha'awar da aka samu daga duk wuraren hadakar tikitin zuwa ga wanda ya yi sa'a. Maido da kuɗin ku a duk lokacin da kuke so.
page-dapps.page-dapps-editors-choice-uniswap: Musanya kuɗin ku cikin sauƙi. Al'ummar da aka fi so wanda ke ba ku damar yin ciniki tare da jama'a a faɗin hanyar sadarwa.
page-dapps.page-dapps-explore-dapps-description: A lot of dapps are still experimental, testing the possibilities of decentralized networks. But there have been some successful early movers in the technology, financial, gaming and collectibles categories.
page-dapps.page-dapps-features-1-description: Da zarar an tura shi zuwa Ethereum, ba za a iya saukar da lambardapp ba. Kuma kowa zai iya amfani da fasalin dapp din. Ko da ƙungiyar da ke bayan dapp ɗin ta watse zaka iya amfani da ita. Da zarar yana kan Ethereum, zai tsaya a can.
page-dapps.page-dapps-features-2-description: Ba za a iya hana ku amfani da dapp ba ko ƙaddamar da kasuwanci ba. Misali, idan Twitter yana kan Ethereum, babu wanda zai iya kulle asusunku ko ya hana ku aika saƙo ba.
page-dapps.page-dapps-features-3-description: Saboda Ethereum yana da ETH, biyan kuɗaden asali ne ga Ethereum. Masu ƙirƙira ba sa buƙatar ɓata lokaci don haɗawa da masu ba da biyan kuɗi na wasu ɓangaren.
page-dapps.page-dapps-features-4-description: Lambar Dapp galibi tana cikin buɗewa kuma tana dacewa zuwa ga asali. Ma'aikatan suna gini akai-akai ta amfani da aikin wasu ma'aikatan. Idan kuna son barin masu amfani su musanya token a cikin dapp ɗinku, kuna iya kawai shiga uwa wani lambar dapp ɗin.
page-dapps.page-dapps-features-5-description: Tare da mafi yawancin dapps, ba kwa buƙatar raba ainihinku ku. Asusun Ethereum shine abun shigan ku da kuma kawai kuna buƙatar walet.
page-dapps.page-dapps-features-6-description: Cryptography yana tabbatar da cewa masu kutse ba za su iya ƙirƙira ma'amaloli da sauran mu'amalar dapp a madadin ku ba. Kuna ba da izinin ayyukan dapp tare da asusun Ethereum yawanci ta hanyar walat ɗin ku don tabbatar da tsaron ku.
page-dapps.page-dapps-features-7-description: Da zarar dapp yana aiki akan Ethereum, zai ragu kawai idan ita kanta Ethereum din ta faɗi. Hanyoyin sadarwar Ethereum dai dai girma su suna da wahalar kai hari sosai.
page-dapps.page-dapps-finance-benefits-1-descriptio: Ayyukan kuɗi da ke gudana akan Ethereum ba su da buƙatun rajista. Idan kuna da kuɗi da haɗin intanet, kuna kan saiti.
page-dapps.page-dapps-finance-benefits-2-descriptio: Akwai duniyar token da zaku iya hulɗa da su a cikin waɗannan samfuran kuɗi. Mutane suna gina sabbin tokens akan Ethereum koda yaushe.
page-dapps.page-dapps-finance-benefits-3-descriptio: Ƙungiyoyin sun gina stablecoins - ƙarancin cryptocurrency mara ƙarfi. Waɗannan suna ba ku damar gwaji da amfani da crypto ba tare da haɗari da rashin tabbas ba.
page-dapps.page-dapps-finance-benefits-4-descriptio: Samfuran kuɗi a cikin Ethereum duk na zamani ne kuma sun dace da juna. Sabbin saiti na waɗannan samfuran suna shiga kasuwa a koda yaushe, suna kara abin da zaku iya yi da crypton ku.
page-dapps.page-dapps-finance-benefits-description: Menene game da Ethereum da yake bawa ayyukan kudade masu cin 'yancin gashin kansu damar bunƙasa?
page-dapps.page-dapps-finance-description: Waɗannan ayyuka ne da suka karkatu zuwa gina ayyukan hada hadar kudade ta anfani da cryptocurrencies. Suna bada damar lamuni, rance, kudin ruwa da kuma biyan kudi cikin sirri, ba tare da anyi anfani da bayanin kuba.
page-dapps.page-dapps-gaming-benefits-1-description: Ko ƙasar kama-da-wane ce ko katunan ciniki, ana iya siyar da kayan ku akan kasuwannin tara abubuwa. Abubuwan ku na cikin wasan suna da daraja ta gaske a idon duniya.
page-dapps.page-dapps-gaming-benefits-1-title: Abubuwan wasanni da aka ninka a sunan kuɗi
page-dapps.page-dapps-gaming-benefits-2-description: Kun mallaki abubuwanku, kuma a wasu lokutan ci gaban ku, ba kamfanonin wasa ba. Don haka ba za ku rasa komai ba idan aka kai wa kamfanin da ke goyon bayan wasan hari, ya sami matsalar uwar garke, ko kuma ya wargaje.
page-dapps.page-dapps-gaming-benefits-3-description: Hakanan ana samun biyan kuɗin Ethereum ga kowa don tantancewa, wasanni na iya amfani da wannan ingancin don tabbatar da gaskiya. A ka'ida, ana iya tabbatar da komai daga adadin manyan afkuwa zuwa girman abokan hamayya.
page-dapps.page-dapps-gaming-benefits-description: Menene game da Ethereum da yake bawa wasanni masu cin gashin kansu damar bunkasuwa?
page-dapps.page-dapps-gaming-description: Wadannan aikace-aikace ne waɗanda ke mai da hankali kan virtula world masu fada da juna ta amfani da abubuwan tarawa wadanda ke da ƙima a idon duniya.
page-dapps.page-dapps-get-some-eth-description: Ayyukan Dapp suna sa a biya kudin hada hada
page-dapps.page-dapps-get-started-subtitle: Don gwada dapp, kuna buƙatar wallet da dan ETH. Wallet zai baku damar hadawa, ko shiga. Kuma kuna buƙatar ETH don biyan kowane kuɗin ciniki.
page-dapps.page-dapps-hero-header: Kayan aiki da ayyukar ɗaukar nauyin Ethereum
page-dapps.page-dapps-hero-subtitle: Dapps motsi ne na haɓaka manhajojin da ke amfani da Ethereum don tarwatsa tsarin kasuwanci ko ƙirƙira sababbi.
page-dapps.page-dapps-how-dapps-work-p1: Dapps suna da tsarin rarrabawa (smart contracts) da ke aiki akan hanyar sadarwar da aka raba ba sava bata tsakiya ba. Suna amfani da Ethereum blockchain don ajiyar bayanai da smart contracts don ayyukan manhajojin su.
page-dapps.page-dapps-how-dapps-work-p2: Smart contract kamar saitin ƙa'idodi ne waɗanda ke rayuwa akan mu'amala da kiripto don kowa ya gani kuma ya gudana daidai bisa ga wadannan ƙa'idodin. Ka yi tunanin injin sayar da kayayyaki: idan ka ba shi isasshen kuɗi da zaɓin da ya dace, za ku sami abin da kuke so. Kuma kamar injinan siyarwa, smart contract na iya ɗaukar kuɗi kamar asusun Ethereum. Wannan yana ba da damar tsari don daidaita yarjejeniya da ma'amaloli.
page-dapps.page-dapps-how-dapps-work-p3: Da zarar an dora dapps akan hanyar sadarwar Ethereum ba za ku iya canza su ba. Ana iya raba Dapps saboda ana sarrafa su ta hanyar dabaru da aka rubuta a cikin contract din, ba wai mutum ko kamfani ba.
page-dapps.page-dapps-learn-callout-description: Portal din al'ummar developers din mu yana da takardu, kayan aiki, da tsare-tsare don taimaka muku don fara gina dapp.
page-dapps.page-dapps-learn-callout-image-alt: Misalin hannun gina alamar ETH daga tubalin lego.
page-dapps.page-dapps-magic-behind-dapps-descriptio: Dapps na iya ji kamar manhajoji na yau da kullum. Amma a bayan fage suna da wasu halaye na musamman saboda sun gaji dukkan masu karfin ikon Ethereum. Ga abin da ya bambanta dapps daga sauran manhajojin.
page-dapps.page-dapps-magic-behind-dapps-link: Me ya mayar da Ethereum shahararre?
page-dapps.page-dapps-metaverse-benefits-descriptio: Menene game da Ethereum da yake bawa meteverse damar tsayuwa da ƙafarsa?
page-dapps.page-dapps-metaverse-benefits-1-descript: Abubuwa na musamman na cikin wasanni waɗanda mallakin masu amfani ne da kuma masu yin mu'amala a duniyar fasaha da kasuwanni masu goyan bayan ƙa'idodi iri ɗaya.
page-dapps.page-dapps-metaverse-benefits-2-descript: Asalin da masu amfani suka mallaka ne tare da damar maki marar iyaka don bincikawa da kuma ƙirƙirar cibiyoyin sadarwar jama'a a cikin duniyoyin kwantance.
page-dapps.page-dapps-metaverse-description: Waɗannan manhajoji ne waɗanda ke ba masu asusu damar shiga duniyar kama da wane a bayyane. Masu amfani za su iya ƙirƙirar cibiyoyin sadarwa na sirri kuma su mallaki kadarorin yanar gizo
page-dapps.page-dapps-set-up-a-wallet-description: Walet itace hanya shiga dapp dinku
page-dapps.page-dapps-social-description: Waɗannan manhajoji ne waɗanda ke mayar da hankali kan ƙirƙirar cibiyoyin sadarwar mai cin gashin kanta ta hanyar amfani da fasahohin tantancewa waɗanda aka rarraba su inda masu amfani ke da bayanan dijital da jadawali na zamantakewa.
page-dapps.page-dapps-technology-description: Waɗannan manhajoji ne waɗanda ke mai da hankali kan rarraba kayan aiki masu cin gashin kansu, haɗa tsarin tattalin arziƙin crypto cikin fasahar da ake da su, da ƙirƙirar kasuwanni don ayyukan haɓaka tushen open source.
page-dapps.page-dapps-wallet-callout-description: Walet suma dapp ne fa. Nemo ɗaya daga ciki wanda tayi ma.
page-dapps.page-dapps-warning-message: Ethereum sabuwar fasaha ce kuma yawancin manhajoji sababbi ne. Kafin ku saka duk wani adadi mai yawa na kuɗi, ku tabbatar kun fahimci haɗarin.
page-dapps.page-dapps-more-on-defi-button: Game da kuɗi masu cin gashin kansu

page-dapps.page-dapps-dapp-description-curve: Curve shine dex wanda aka mayar da hankali akan stable coin
page-dapps.page-dapps-dapp-description-dodo: DODO shine mai ba da kayan aiki akan on-chain, wanda ke ba da dama na Proactive Market Maker algorithm (PMM)
page-dapps.page-dapps-dapp-description-artblocks: An sadaukar da Art Blocks don kawo kyawawan ayyuka na fasaha na zamani zuwa rayuwa

page-developers-index.page-developers-about: Bayanai akan waɗannan bukatun mai ƙirƙiran
page-developers-index.page-developers-about-desc: ethereum.org na nan don taimaka muku wajen gini da Ethereum da kuma rubutattun tsarin abubuwan tushe da kuma abubuwan tari na cigaba. Bugu da ƙari akwai koyarwa da zai ɗaura ku a hanya da wuri.
page-developers-index.page-developers-about-desc-2: Ilhamar ya samu ne daga haɗakar kungiyar Mozilla, mun dauka Ethereum na da bukatar guri ne da zai kunshi abubuwar masu ƙirƙira da kuma abubuwan bukatu masu girma ne. Kamar abokan mu a Mozilla, komai a nan a buɗe suke kuma a shirye suka don ka faɗaɗa da kuma inganta su.
page-developers-index.page-developers-account-desc: Kwangiloli ko ko mutanen da suke kan hanyar sadarwan
page-developers-index.page-developers-api-desc: Ana amfani da labirari don yin hulɗa tare da smart contracts

page-developers-index.page-developers-block-explorers-desc: Hanyar shafin ka na bayanan Ethereum
page-developers-index.page-developers-dev-env-desc: IDEs na taimakawa wajen haɓaka dapp
page-developers-index.page-developers-evm-desc: Kwamfuta da ke sarrafa hada-hadan kasuwanci
